item.title: Apollo will close down on June 30th
item.description: - Apollo, a popular third-party Reddit app for iPhone, is shutting down on June 30th due to the new expensive API pricingÂ introduced by Reddit.

item.title: iOS 17 automatically removes tracking parameters from links you click on
item.description: - This article is not available, as it is set in the future (June 7, 2023).

item.title: Google doesn't want employees working remotely anymore
item.description: - Google has announced they do not want employees working remotely anymore and are pushing for a hybrid work schedule.

item.title: The Last Egg
item.description: - South Pole station has limited access to fresh food during the winter due to the extreme conditions and the fact that most of their food is deep-frozen until needed.

item.title: Reddit is Fun will shut down on June 30th in response to Reddit API changes
item.description: - The developer of the popular "rif is fun for Reddit" Android app has announced that they will shut down on June 30, 2023 due to changes to Reddit's API and what they perceive as hostile treatment of developers.

item.title: r/ProgrammerHumor will be shutting down to protest Reddit's API changes
item.description: - r/ProgrammerHumor is shutting down indefinitely on June 12th to protest Reddit's recent API changes which affect 3rd party apps.

item.title: Understanding GPT tokenizers
item.description: - GPT-3/4, LLaMA, and PaLM tokenize text data by converting it into integers.

item.title: Mechanical Apple Watch from real e-waste Apple Watch
item.description: - An individual has created a mechanical Apple Watch using parts from a second-hand Apple Watch, Seiko NH38 movement, bronze sheet, brass tube, and a rotor from Mod Mode Watches to create a unique timepiece.

item.title: Nanoplastic Ingestion Causes Neurological Deficits
item.description: - Nanoplastic particles less than 500 nanometers in size may be more harmful than larger microplastics as they induce a greater immune response in the gut and negatively affect neurological function in mice.

item.title: Sync will shut down on June 30
item.description: - Sync, a popular third-party Reddit app, will be shutting down on June 30, 2023, due to upcoming API changes.
